task.summary:
This a prototype to use zuul to support multi controllers
Say a service like registration would support all saas controller, when the service needs to send rest request to a controller, it would have to use the url and host name of that controller to create a client(feign maybe), so each service must have its connection management for all the controllers.
But if we can support this by zuul, then the service only need to send request to a fixed url with parameter, then zuul will redirect the request to corresponding serivce according to that parameter, or do it by connection by itself. Either way, the service wouldn't need to handle this by itself and all the service can share it.
What I did here: 1. define 2 services echo-service and echo-service2, which are not registered to eureka in order to mimic saas controller, but they do provide an api to retrieve status, a simple html page here. 3. use routeFilter to redirect request to echo-serivce/echo-serivce2 according to parameter in url.

MESSAGE.value:
This a prototype to use zuul to support multi controllers
Say a service like registration would support all saas controller, when the service needs to send rest request to a controller, it would have to use the url and host name of that controller to create a client(feign maybe), so each service must have its connection management for all the controllers.
But if we can support this by zuul, then the service only need to send request to a fixed url with parameter, then zuul will redirect the request to corresponding serivce according to that parameter, or do it by connection by itself. Either way, the service wouldn't need to handle this by itself and all the service can share it.
What I did here: 1. define 2 services echo-service and echo-service2, which are not registered to eureka in order to mimic saas controller, but they do provide an api to retrieve status, a simple html page here. 3. use routeFilter to redirect request to echo-serivce/echo-serivce2 according to parameter in url.
